meanings.definition: An alloy of lead and tin used to coat iron or steel
meanings.sent1: The workers applied a layer of terne to the steel beams for protection.
meanings.sent2: The terne coating on the metal prevents rusting.
meanings.sent3: The terne mixture gleamed in the sunlight, giving the building a shiny look.
meanings.sent4: The terne acted as a shield, guarding the metal from corrosion.
meanings.sent5: The terne application process was crucial in preserving the integrity of the structure.

meanings.sent1: They decided to terne the roof to enhance its durability.
meanings.sent2: He carefully terne the surface to ensure even coverage.
meanings.sent3: The workers terne the entire surface in record time, impressing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: She terne the object with precision, leaving no spot uncovered.
meanings.sent5: Terneing the material required skill and attention to detail.

meanings.sent1: The terne roof shone brightly under the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The gate was a terne structure, blending well with the surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The terne material gave the building a unique and modern appearance.
meanings.sent4: Her terne jewelry collection was admired for its elegant simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The terne finish on the car made it stand out among the rest.
